body: Currently the default behaviour in the card explorer/editor is that as the mouse cursor moves over an entry in the card pool it should immediately display the associated image. I cannot believe anyone finds this useful since the trigger is based on the card pool row height of about 18 pixels which means a slight nudge of the mouse and the image changes. It is also a great way to fill up the image cache without even trying. Personally, I think this behaviour should be removed but at the very least the "Preview card on select only" option should be on by default - the current default behaviour can actually be emulated by keeping the mouse button pressed and dragging the mouse.
author: [lodici123](https://code.google.com/u/lodici123/)
title: Make "Preview card on select only" on by default.

comments.body:
I'd agree with switching the default setting, however I've not had an issue with the issue cache while having -Xms512M -Xmx1024M.

It could be that I've just got used to having it on mouse-over, even with 1920x1200 resolution (Which we know is nowhere near the highest resolution being used). However there have been times when I've found it to be annoying :)

_From [lodici123](https://code.google.com/u/lodici123/) on August 15, 2014 16:04:24_

Currently the default behaviour in the card explorer/editor is that as the mouse cursor moves over an entry in the card pool it should immediately display the associated image. I cannot believe anyone finds this useful since the trigger is based on the card pool row height of about 18 pixels which means a slight nudge of the mouse and the image changes. It is also a great way to fill up the image cache without even trying. Personally, I think this behaviour should be removed but at the very least the "Preview card on select only" option should be on by default - the current default behaviour can actually be emulated by keeping the mouse button pressed and dragging the mouse.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/magarena/issues/detail?id=653_
